image.altText: Lightning among fireworks on a river.

props.synopsis: From sombre commemoration to thunderstruck fireworks, people gathered around Australia to welcome in 2026.

title.children: Australia rings in 2026 with sombre commemoration, rainy fireworks

image.altText: A man wearing a helmet while looking out the door of a helicopter which is flying over tsuanmi-devastated land

props.synopsis: From expectations of a trade union backlash against controversial industrial relations reform, to concerns about "homegrown" extremism in Australia, here are what previously unseen cabinet documents tell us about Australian politics in 2005.

title.children: Efforts to mitigate 'homegrown' extremism revealed in cabinet documents

image.altText: A hand holds a block calendar with 01 January set as its date.

props.synopsis: New Year's Day brings a host of new laws, regulations and guidelines into effect. Here's a quick breakdown of some of the changes.

title.children: Australian-made content and cheaper medication among January 1 changes

image.altText: two men with champagne on a yacht

props.synopsis: They should be celebrating a historic win. Instead, the crew of BNC is coming to terms with how a "silly mistake" — their words — cost them the "crown jewel" prize of the Sydney to Hobart overall handicap.

title.children: How a 'silly mistake' cost these men Sydney to Hobart glory

image.altText: Damien Martyn plays in the nets

props.synopsis: Former Australian Test and limited overs batsman Damien Martyn is in hospital in Queensland in an induced coma after falling ill this week.

title.children: Ex-Australian cricketer Damien Martyn seriously ill in induced coma

image.altText: People being helped out of a train carriage window as onlookers look shocked.

props.synopsis: A head-on collision between two tourist trains near Peru's most famous landmark kills a train driver and injures dozens.

title.children: Five Australians safe after fatal train crash near Machu Picchu

image.altText: Firefighter in the field at Dolphin Sands, December 2025.

props.synopsis: After 19 homes were destroyed by bushfire in a picturesque east coast Tasmanian community, residents are now reporting instances of looting — described by the state premier as "disgraceful".

title.children: 'Disgraceful' acts of looting in bushfire-ravaged community

image.altText: Nick McKenzie wearing a blue suit and tie

props.synopsis: Investigators from a taskforce targeting crime in the construction industry say a 31-year-old man threatened journalist Nick McKenzie in a Christmas Eve call.

title.children: Man charged with making threatening phone call to Melbourne journalist

image.altText: A boat dingy capsized on rocks near ocean.

props.synopsis: Police confirmed one man has drowned and a 14-year-old boy is missing after their boat capsized at Palm Beach on Sydney's Northern Beaches, with a search and rescue helicopter continuing to search the area.

title.children: Man dead and 14yo boy missing after boat capsizes at Sydney beach

image.altText: A woman gestures as she speaks into a microphone at a lectern

props.synopsis: There are just two toilets for women near the main hall in Japan's parliament, with nearly 60 MPs calling for changes to the building to match growing female representation.

title.children: Female MPs in Japan want more toilets in parliament

image.altText: Men walk in front of people standing on a footpath giving them roses

props.synopsis: The release is a key part of a ceasefire deal struck to bring peace to the border between the two countries.

title.children: 'I am so happy': Crowd celebrates Thailand's release of Cambodian soldiers

image.altText: Three portrait-style photos of white men sit on top of a map of an island

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has identified several individuals involved in a network of illegitimate corporate regulators and service firms.

title.children: How illegitimate regulators operate in the name of a tiny African island

image.altText: One of the main entrances to Crown Casino in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: About 500 workers at Melbourne's Crown casino will stop work on Wednesday after rejecting a proposal they say will cut pay for new workers and imperil those currently employed.

title.children: Crown casino workers announce New Year's Eve strike amid wage row

image.altText: Cricket commentator Alex Hartley wears a white sleeveless top.

props.synopsis: Alex Hartley says she was stunned by the reaction to her talking about her period during the BBC's radio commentary of the third Ashes Test.

title.children: Calls for critics to 'grow up' after outcry over period mention on BBC

image.altText: Blurred graffiti on a brick wall.

props.synopsis: A rise in Islamophobic incidents prompts warnings from Muslim organisations that their communities are at risk of "retribution" and "collective punishment" following the mass shooting.

title.children: Some Australian Muslims sleeping overnight in mosques after Bondi massacre

image.altText: An image of a suburban street with leafy trees.

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns said police would "throw the book" at anyone behind flyers distributed to inner-city Newcastle letterboxes.

title.children: 'White Australia' flyer letterbox drop in Newcastle sparks police investigation

image.altText: A glass sculture with a tall, light blue patterned base and a purple bowl on top.

props.synopsis: The art of glassblowing was popularised in a recent reality TV series, but these Australian artists are forging their own paths in the creative process of sculpting this tricky medium.

title.children: Meet the young artists pushing the boundaries of glassmaking

image.altText: woman standing behind a lectern giving a speech

props.synopsis: Tatiana Schlossberg revealed in an essay published in November that she had a rare form of terminal leukaemia.

title.children: JFK's granddaughter Tatiana Schlossberg dies aged 35

image.altText: People with masks walking in front of a building with a brick facade and a banner overhead.

props.synopsis: Protests over soaring prices and a collapsing currency are spreading across Iran, with students joining shopkeepers in calling on the government to take action.

title.children: Iran's widespread cost-of-living protests reach universities

image.altText: A man on a delivery bike looks at a letter with a TV camera filming him on the footpath

props.synopsis: After 401 years, the Danish postal service has ended letter deliveries as the country fully embraces the digital age.

title.children: Denmark becomes first country in world to end letter delivery

image.altText: Katie Wahlheim sits with two border collie dogs, as one looks up with his snout very close to her face

props.synopsis: Within 20 minutes of leaving an Adelaide beach dogs Lucy and Ella began breathing rapidly and fell "terribly sick", prompting their owner to issue a warning.

title.children: Pet owner's warning as dog left 'frothing' after SA beach visit

image.altText: Daniel Morcombe

props.synopsis: Queenslanders can search their local area for reportable sex offenders by providing proof of identification.

title.children: New site lets Queenlanders search online for paedophiles in their area

image.altText: Martin Boyle sits on the ground

props.synopsis: Martin Boyle, no stranger to the heartache of missing major tournaments with the Socceroos, was taken off after injuring his hamstring for Hibernian in the Scottish Premiership.

title.children: Socceroos striker cut down by injury

image.altText: Felix Auger-Aliassime smiles

props.synopsis: After his best year on tour, Canadian star Felix Auger-Aliassime is looking to keep his hot streak running in the United Cup and at the Australian Open.

title.children: Felix hoping to start 2026 with a bang at Aus Open

image.altText: An aerial shot shows a ship in dock. A caption reads: "Unloading the ship of weapons and combat vehicles".

props.synopsis: The UAE has denied shipping weapons to Yemeni separatists after Saudi-led forces said they had bombed arms at the port city of Mukalla.

title.children: 'Teetering on the brink': Fears of Middle East conflict after Saudi strikes in Yemen

image.altText: Two military vehicles drive through woodland. A soldier is stationed on top of the one in front.

props.synopsis: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko, a staunch ally of the Kremlin, announced the deployment of the Oreshnik intermediate-range ballistic missiles earlier this month.

title.children: Nuclear-capable missiles deployed in Belarus, Russia claims

image.altText: Richard Jeffares wears a polo jumper and stands in a brewery, smiling, next to a bag of gluten free grain.

props.synopsis: Brewer Richard Jeffares's Victorian company raised about $2.5 million from 993 investors in a matter of days through a method called crowd-sourced funding, also known as equity crowdfunding.

title.children: Would you invest in your favourite craft beer? Nearly 1,000 people have

image.altText: A large hole drilled into a brick wall with items all over the ground.

props.synopsis: According to police, the robbers drilled their way into the underground vault room of the savings bank from a parking garage.

title.children: Robbers use drill to steal $52m of cash and jewellery from German bank

image.altText: Woodside's offshore North Rankin gas platform at sunset.

props.synopsis: Documents reveal one of Australia's biggest oil and gas companies knowingly shed plastic into the ocean for two months before notifying the offshore regulator.

title.children: Oil and gas giant knowingly shed kilograms of plastic into the ocean

image.altText: Close up of the Sports Bet app on a mobile phone in a woman's hand.

props.synopsis: Gambling giant Sportsbet pressured the Australian Communications and Media Authority into "watering down" enforcement announcement, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: 'Shocking at every level': Watchdog deleted quotes after Sportsbet pressure

image.altText: a pile of gold bullion and coins

props.synopsis: Several gold, lithium and other mining stocks have seen their share price double, and even triple, in 2025 as Australia's share market has had a much better than expected year despite tariffs, economic uncertainty and Donald Trump's ongoing unpredictability.

title.children: Stocks that would have earned you the most money on the ASX in 2025

image.altText: Beth in a hard hat covered in soot

props.synopsis: TV presenter and former builder Barry Du Bois is lobbying Canberra for change.

title.children: First apprenticeship 'hell' for tradie who wants hazing to stop

image.altText: A woman with a bag talks to a man angrily.

props.synopsis: About 80 passengers on the Coral Adventurer are flown home after the cruise ship ran aground on a reef off Papua New Guinea.

title.children: Exhausted passengers arrive home after luxury cruise liner runs aground

image.altText: Hundreds of people lay flowers in front of Bondi beachside pavilion.

props.synopsis: The mass shooting in Bondi and other incidents of mass violence around the world have highlighted that violence can strike anywhere. Here are some expert tips on how to escape, hide, and stay safe.

title.children: What should you do during a violent mass attack?
